title: Stock Futures Creep Up Ahead of GDP Data
sub_head: S&P 500 futures are calm as investors await earnings from Comcast, Mastercard and Amazon
body:
U.S. stock futures edged up ahead of fresh data on economic growth and the labor market that are expected to provide insight into the state of the recovery.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 ticked up 0.2%, after the broad-market index closed down less than 0.1% Wednesday, pointing to muted gains after the opening bell. Dow Jones Industrial Average futures added 0.4%, while Nasdaq-100 futures pulled back slightly, declining 0.1%.
Earnings season is under way with Hershey, Mastercard and Comcast scheduled to report ahead of the opening bell. Amazon . com and T-Mobile are set to post earnings after markets close.
“Most companies are in a pretty positive situation. They have cash, they have demand. It’s something that was a bit expected already from last quarter, but we’re still having positive surprises,” said Ludovic Subran, chief economist at Allianz.
Facebook posted sharp growth in quarterly revenue and profit late Wednesday but shares declined 4% in premarket trading after the company said it expects revenue growth to slow in the second half of the year. Uber fell 4.5% on a report that SoftBank plans to sell about a third of its stake in the company. PayPal slid nearly 5% after reporting a drop in profit in the second quarter.
